intro: Myosotis cognata, commonly known as the purple sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Myosotis cognata has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. It is a perennial plant that produces a basal rosette of foliage and blooms from late spring to early summer.
